Pleasant School District has consistently focused its staff development efforts to address the needs of the students and teachers to increase\rstudent achievement. In the past three years
column3: the professional development for teachers has been to support teachers with the implementation of the\rnewly adopted English Language Arts and Mathematics curriculum. Below are examples of the professional development that the district and schools\rhave provided in the past three years:\r\r2017-18 to 2019-2020\r\r*Teacher Induction: In partnership with Silicon Valley New Teacher Center
column4: the district assists new teachers to clear their teaching credentials. Teachers\rreceive staff development and mentor support from a credential teacher on special assignment to master the standards for the teaching professions and\rcomplete all induction requirements.\r\r*All Grades reviewed essential components of Project-Based Learning (PBL). Teachers received guided support to work collaboratively with grade-level\rpeers and departments to develop a PBL unit that is culturally relevant to the students/communities that we serve. The PBL incorporated the Global\rCitizenship standards to help students understand their role as global citizens who respect and value diversity
column6: work with\rothers to make the world around them more equitable
column7: and help students take responsibility for their actions.\r\r\r2017-18:\r\r*Teachers in 3-8 grade participated in a two-day training (8/21-8/22)
column8: the goal of the training was to learn how to best implement the new English\rLanguage Arts Adoption (EL Education). Follow up training was provided on Jan. 8
column9: 2018.\r\r*All 6-8 grade teachers participated in a two-day training (8/21-8/22) on Integrated ELD. With the use of the ELD/ELA Framework
column10: teachers had the\ropportunity to understand the connection between Integrated ELD and Grade Level Content.\r\rTeachers worked collaboratively across content areas to plan. Follow-up training took place on Jan. 8
column11: 2018.\r\r\r2018-2019\r\rJuly 10-11th:\r\rTeachers met for half a day to collaborate by grade level or department at least once a month. Teachers used cycles of inquiry to monitor student\rprogress. Teachers also developed project-based learning units.\r\rDiscover the power of Language Dives
column12: 3rd-5th-grade teachers. Language Dives empower students to analyze
